abstract: With new episodes of ABC’s “Grey’s Anatomy” and CBS’s “CSI” at 9 p.m. on Thursday, both networks surged to the top of the night’s ratings heap. CBS averaged more total viewers as “CSI” attracted the larger audience of the two hit shows: 18.1 million viewers compared to 17.6 million, according to Nielsen’s estimates. “Grey’s Anatomy,” however, trounced all competition for the night among adults 18 to 49, making ABC No. 1 in that demographic despite a weak showing at 10 p.m. for “Big Shots” (6.8 million).
lead_paragraph: With new episodes of ABC’s “Grey’s Anatomy” and CBS’s “CSI” at 9 p.m. on Thursday, both networks surged to the top of the night’s ratings heap. CBS averaged more total viewers as “CSI” attracted the larger audience of the two hit shows: 18.1 million viewers compared to 17.6 million, according to Nielsen’s estimates. “Grey’s Anatomy,” however, trounced all competition for the night among adults 18 to 49, making ABC No. 1 in that demographic despite a weak showing at 10 p.m. for “Big Shots” (6.8 million).
